name: The Salisbury Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish I had something nice to say about this hotel but there were too many little issues that built up to ensure a very disappointing stay. I guess the room was very large and the sheets were clean.
reviews.title: Many small problems add up to one big disappointment

reviews.text: However, the room smelt subtly of smoke, like it had absorbed into the carpet. It seemed dated and tacky with mismatched furnishings that looked unlike the photos online. There were cushions which were stained and had holes in them. The bed was ok but the mattress was thin so we felt springs, it also sloped downwards so our head was slightly lower than our feet. The bathroom door creaked and didn’t close properly, the toilet roll holder was broken, the toilet not properly cleaned, scum left on the body wash container, hot water was brown (although not the cold).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor with our door about 4m from the reception desk, so we heard every single noise and conversation from reception. Not fantastic for a romantic honeymoon getaway.
reviews.title: Much less value than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included but there was a surcharge for hot food – unlike the past 6 hotels we'd stayed at. Internet was free but we found it slow and unreliable. No umbrellas were available despite the weather conditions in Edinburgh, also unlike our previous 6 hotels.
reviews.title: Friendly, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the location isn't that close to the city centre and all the issues listed above I don't know how they an charge 180 pounds/ night. If they were charging a more reasonable price then our expectations may have been more closely matched to what we experienced.
reviews.title: Wedding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for our mini-moon (before our main honeymoon!) and it was great. The room we had was on the ground floor and wasn't massive, but it was lovely and had a great view of the back garden. One strange thing we noticed was that we could hear what sounded to us like a leak coming from the room above. We reported it and it was looked into, but nothing was found. However, we continued to hear the noise every night. It didn't overly bother us or keep us awake, it was just a little strange. It didn't appear from the reaction of the staff that this was something that had been reported before, so I'm sure it's all fine now. The hotel is a little walk from the Royal Mile etc, but it's a lovely walk particularly if you go via the Meadows. It's a very safe area and there are loads of brilliant places to eat nearby so there's no need to walk back into town if you don't want to. All in all we really liked this hotel and would stay again. Very nice!
reviews.title: Really nice hotel, very friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms excellent very mod and super bathrooms with high quality robes, towels and accessories. Wonderful to have a garden for day and evening use with the added bonus of welcoming effiicent anf friendly staff and a real high quality chef. Prices are very resonable especially the special lunches. The evening restaurant meals are on a par with very expensive venues elsewhere and nowwhere near the price---Cafe/Bistro Cassis is a the real 'jewel in the Crown'. The Hotel is 5 min walk from the gates to Holyrood Park and the newly refurbished Commonwealth Pool--it re=opens late 2011--- the bus stop to the City Centre is 1 min away &its a 6-7 min ride or a 20-25min walk in.
reviews.title: superb spot

reviews.text: Stayed here for a graduation and city break with friends, 2 nights, 7th and 8th of July.
reviews.title: Beautiful georgian house, lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit short for time so took a taxi from Waverley Station, think it was abou 6-8 pounds.
reviews.title: Well placed hotel with parking
Some minor problems
reviews.text: LOCATION: The hotel is located in two lovely georgian houses in a quiet residencial area. It is quite a walk from Princes Street, about 20 minutes. No trouble, there's lots of shops and supermarkets on the way and in route of many buses that take into the city centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a small bedroom and the bed was also too small (my husband is 6ft 3). the bathroom had a slding door that did not close properly allowing bathroom smells into the bedroom .overall the bathroom was tiny although the shower was easily big enough.the bathroom intruded into the bedroom space and when flushing the loo,a macherator kicked in to make things noisy and when we tried to go to sleep the lights from outside prevented this from happening.,as the curtains were either too light or insufficiently lined
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.text: the restaurant doesnt open on mondays ,so we were unable to sample its wares or comment save that an hotel without food facilities is disappointing.
reviews.title: We could not have been more pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we shall not be returning to the Salisbury.
reviews.title: Great Potential, lacking in details

reviews.text: We arrived earlier than check in time and were very happy that our room was available and we could go ahead and check in. The staff was very helpful in assisting us, even when we had had a bag break and needed a repair. The room was excellent, very quiet with a large bathroom equipped with a spa like bathtub. We had ample supplies of coffee and tea in our room as well as hot cocoa. The hotel was in a nice neighborhood and just far enough off of the main road to not be noisy. The bus line was very convenient and got us to where we needed to be easily. I really liked that we had a table with our room name in the breakfast room so we did not have to worry about finding a seat in the morning.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, but a long walk from the center of town

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Salisbury Hotel in May 2011 during our visit to Edinburgh. I had requested an upstairs room, king bed - quiet location. The room very much fit that bill. However, the wi-fi would not work in our room. We were told it had to do with the age of the building and the thick stone walls. The toilet seat was broken (a full - thickness crack through the seat - very obvious to the eye) and askew. The modern shower, while lovely to look at, would flood the entire bathroom to the bathroom door threshold. The shower head would not stay in position and would slowly 'bow' (tip down) during the shower. Front desk staff was informed. The toilet seat was replaced, but the underlying reason for the break was not addressed. The new seat remained askew because one of the bolts intended to secure the seat to the toilet was completely stripped and provided no anchor for the seat. We learned to carefully position the shower head so it would remain upright.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and friendly staff

reviews.text: We were at the Salisbury hotel two weeks ago. We loved our stay. The hotel is clean, the staff members are great. The price is perfcet for its quality. The breakfast is a plus. The rooms and bathroom are clean and spotless. The location is perfect. If you want to have a great stay in Edinburg go to Salisbury hotel. My only suggestion will be to place a better signs of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Everything is perfect"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel - mix of modern and old style. We had troubles finding it as there was no sign or big street number on the outside. The parking is tiny but under video control. Finally got some nice fresh breakfast in Scotland! The hotel is next to a main boulevard that can take you straight in the centre (good bus connection). 200m away there is a great very fashionable pub with good food and spirits.
reviews.title: Great with good location (not very central)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had remembered it was our wedding annivesary and gave us a lovely large room with a bottle of wine on the house! The staff were all really helpful and friendly, giving out bus numbers and routes to get to help us get around.Breakfast was good and included in our room rate and the option to upgrade to a cooked breakfast was offered. All in all, we would be more than happy to stay there again and have already recommended it others.
reviews.title: Thank you for a lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty good hotel with helpful and friendly staff. The room was clean and pleasantly furnished though pretty small. Our shower only had glass blocking halfway into the bathroom so things got a bit wet. The other things some guests might be bothered by was that the hallways in the early mornings weren't very quiet. We could hear guests and staff come and go. (this may only affect the 2-3 rooms between the stairs and the door to breakfast in the basement). The hotel clearly takes some care in its appearance but there are a number of small things that hold it back from being a great hotel. It suited our needs well enough but we wouldn't particularly seek it out.
reviews.title: decent hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the holyrood suite. It was enormous and beautifully decorated. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood just south of the main tourist area, far enough away to feel secluded, but a nice walk or a cheap taxi ride from everything you would want to see. I can't recommend this place highly enough!
reviews.title: Enormous room, reasonable price

description: Salisbury Hotel is a restored Georgian Townhouse quietly located amidst walled gardens yet central for all main tourist attractions & the main bus route; 18 luxuriously appointed rooms, with i-pod, wi-fi, plasma tv, and en suite power-showers. Single, ground-floor, 4-poster, family and garden facing rooms available. Gabbro bistro provides excellent quality Scottish cuisine and the lounge area offers a selection of wines, beers and whiskies in relaxed surroundings. Expect contemporary style, period surroundings and great service. Private parking.
